summary: Compound's outstanding debt on Ethereum surpassed $1 billion, according to The Block's data dashboard.
title: Compound's outstanding debt on Ethereum hits $1 billion
content: Decentralized lending protocol Compound's outstanding debt on Ethereum surpassed $1 billion-- the highest it has been in a year, according to The Block's data dashboard.

The increase in outstanding debt represents a shift in the crypto market, which was hammered by a credit crisis in 2022. Across the board lenders from BlockFi to Celsius declared bankruptcy, resulting in a gap in crypto's market structure. On July 14, outstanding debt stood at $1.07 billion.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/decentralized-finance/cryptocurrency-lending/compound-outstanding-debt-weekly/embed" title="Compound Outstanding Debt" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
Compound is a money market protocol where users can borrow and lend assets. Interest rates are determined algorithmically. COMP token holders govern the Compound protocol.
